plot: The Top Gear team tests the Citroën Berlingo Multispace; the ludicrously fast, Pagani Zonda; the exquisite, Lamborghini Murciélago; and the family sedan, Mazda6. The first brave star in a reasonably-priced car is Harry Enfield.

Jeremy drives the Pagani Zonda, Italy's newest supercar. We meet The Stig as he tests the myth that if you drive past a speed camera quickly enough, it cannot take your picture. We find out how it is possible to run a car on vegetable oil. The team kick off a new regular segment when comedian Harry Enfield is the first Star In A Reasonably Priced Car.—Allister Coots

The Top Gear team puts to the test the spacious, Citroën Berlingo Multispace; the ludicrously fast, Pagani Zonda; the exquisite, Lamborghini Murciélago; and the family sedan, Mazda6. The Stig tries to beat the infamous speed cameras, and the first brave star in a reasonably-priced car is the writer, actor, and producer, Harry Enfield.—Nick Riganas
